cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north then north-northeast across the central Gulf and approach the southeast Louisiana coast mid-week

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central U.S. Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to coastal Alabama
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes – potential 3-5 ft surge for southeast Louisiana shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm to possibly Category-1 hurricane winds (40–80 mph) likely during landfall window
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rise of 3–5 ft above ground level possible along Plaquemines Parish coast and lower Mississippi River outlets
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated 6 inches, bringing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and very rough seas/strong currents impacting vessel operations and offshore approaches
